bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 78 (Tuesday, May 9, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. FOXX:H.R. 3140.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:ArticleI, Section 8, Clauses 3, 4, and 18.The single subject of this legislation is:Requiring states Attorneys General to give priority tovictims of crimes committed by people in the countryillegally when distributing federal funding under the Victimsof Crime Act of 1984.[Page H2173]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Justice for Victims of Open Borders Act of 2023

This bill requires a state crime victim compensation program, in order to be eligible for grants, to certify that it prioritizes making payments to victims of crimes committed by individuals who are unlawfully present in the United States.

bill.title: Justice for Victims of Open Borders Act of 2023

item.title: Justice for Victims of Open Borders Act of 2023
Justice for Victims of Open Borders Act of 2023
To amend the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 with respect to crime victim compensation program eligibility, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
